numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a common theme in this graph.
2. In most countries, the percentage of people who are 15-24 years old is higher than the percentage of people who are 40 years old or older.
3. Many people who are 15-24 years old believe that generations get better as time goes on.
4. Many people who are 40 years old or older do not believe that generations get better as time goes on.
5. I wonder why the younger age group believes this.
6. The younger age group is closer in age to newer generations.
7. The younger age group grew up in a similar fashion to newer generations.
8. I think that these facts can explain the belief of the younger age group.
9. The older age group grew up very differently from the younger generation.
10. The older age group believes that the younger generation is not better.
11. The younger generation may have different morals than the older generation.
12. The younger generation may have different beliefs than the older generation.
13. These differences can make it difficult for the older age group to understand the younger generation.
15. My community lives in a generation that is very different from my grandparents' generation.
16. A new headline for this graph could be "New vs. Old".
